newsitem.title: UK: North Sea firm as wet Brent trades at June -27 cts.
newsitem.headline: North Sea firm as wet Brent trades at June -27 cts.

text.p: North Sea crudes were firm early on Wednesday as Dated Brent traded at a narrower discount to June paper, traders said.
A Brent cargo loading May 8-10 was sold by a major oil company to a U.S. refiner for June Brent less 27 cents, four cents more than the buyer paid for a May 6-8 cargo on Tuesday.
"This market is still looking pretty healthy," said a trader.
The U.S. refiner has fixed a Very Large Crude Carrier (VLCC) to take four cargoes of Brent to the U.S. Gulf and is expected to keep two of the cargoes for its own system.
